title: Please just give me the correct syntax to boot Acronis trueimage 2016 from usb

forumNotes.author: livedude
forumNotes.content:
Hey Guys

long ago, i createt with some help from you guys the ultimate recover usb-stick /iso.

now it needs an update.

i createt a boot iso from acronis trueimage 2016 and tried to start it from usb with the me known methods.

it dosen t work.

i only need the correct syntax to do this wich might be only a few lines.

please give me just the few lines.

please don t try to bludgeon me to learn basics and things i don t need.

i only want update my usb stick and therefore i only need the few lines.

here is the content of my menu.lst.

there you see how i start things and have all the informations you need.

so again, please give me only the correct syntax.

don t give me basic examples of how the wheel get inventet.

i don t have the time for that and i don t want that.

i only need the few lines with correct syntax to start acronis trueimage image recovery iso from usb, not more.

if this thread is in the wrong section, i am sorry for that, then please move it to the correct section.

i have no idea about all that.

i only need the correct syntax.

thanks in advance

--------------------------------  
splashimage /Boot/face.gz  
default 0  
title Win7PE_SE (Windows7-Live-System/In Ram-Boot/Min. 800MB Ram!  
map /ISO/Win7PE_SE-wim.iso (hd32)  
map --hook  
map --heads=0 --sectors-per-track=0 /TrueImageHome2016.iso  
chainloader (hd32)  
boot  
title TrueImageHome2012  
map /ISO/TrueImageHome2012.iso (hd32)  
map --hook  
chainloader (hd32)  
boot  
title Acronis True Image Home 2016  
map /ISO/TrueImageHome2016.iso (hd32)  
map --hook  
chainloader (hd32)  
boot  
title Redo-Backup-and-Recovery-1.0.1-stable  
find --set-root --ignore-floppies /ISO/Redo-Backup-and-Recovery-1.0.1-stable.iso  
map /ISO/Redo-Backup-and-Recovery-1.0.1-stable.iso (0xff) \|\| map --mem /ISO/Redo-Backup-and-Recovery-1.0.1-stable.iso (0xff)  
map --hook  
root (0xff)  
kernel /casper/vmlinuz cdrom-detect/try-usb=true noprompt floppy.allowed_drive_mask=0 ignore_uuid boot=casper iso-scan/filename=/ISO/Redo-Backup-and-Recovery-1.0.1-stable.iso vga=791 locale=es_ES bootkbd=es console-setup/layoutcode=es quiet splash  
initrd /casper/initrd.gz  
title Partition Wizzard  
map /ISO/PartitionWizzard.iso (hd32)  
map --hook  
chainloader (hd32)  
boot  
title PartetMagic.27.2.2012  
find --set-root /pmagic/pmagic_2012_2_27.iso  
map --heads=0 --sectors-per-track=0 /pmagic/pmagic_2012_2_27.iso (hd32)  
map --hook  
root (hd32)  
chainloader  
title TestDisk-6-13-FreeDos-BootCD  
map /ISO/TestDisk-6-13-FreeDos-BootCD.iso (hd32)  
map --hook  
chainloader (hd32)  
boot  
title MemTest86+ 4.20  
kernel /ISO/MEMTEST.BIN  
lock  
title Plop Boot Manager  
kernel /ISO/PLPBT.BIN  
lock  
title UBCD-FreeDosV.340  
map /ISO/UBCD-FreeDosV.340.iso (hd32)  
map --hook  
chainloader (hd32)  
boot  
title Install Windows 7 (HP, PROF, \& ULTIMATE 32 \& 64bit)\\nRun the Windows 7 install DVD ISO image  
map /ZISO/Windows7AIO.iso (0xff)  
map --hook  
chainloader (0xff)  
title Install Windows-Professional-SP3 Installation (Min 711MB Ram)  
find --set-root /ISO/firadisk.img  
map --mem /ISO/firadisk.img (fd0)  
map --mem /ISO/WindowsXP-Pro-SP3.iso (hd32)  
map --hook  
root (hd32)  
chainloader  
title Install Windows-XP-Home-SP3 Installation (Min 711MB Ram)  
find --set-root /ISO/firadisk.img  
map --mem /ISO/firadisk.img (fd0)  
map --mem /ISO/WindowsXP-Home-SP3.iso (hd32)  
map --hook  
root (hd32)  
chainloader  
title Find and Load Microsoft Windows Vista/Win7  
root (hd0,0)  
chainloader (hd0,0)/bootmgr  
title Find and Load NTLDR of Windows NT/2K/XP  
find --set-root /ntldr  
chainloader /ntldr  
title Find and Load CMLDR of Windows NT/2K/XP  
find --set-root /cmldr  
chainloader /cmldr  
title Find and Load Microsoft Windows Vista/Win7  
map (hd0) (hd1)  
map (hd1) (hd0)  
map --hook  
rootnoverify (hd0)  
chainloader +1  
title Find and Load NTLDR of Windows NT/2K/XP  
find --set-root /ntldr  
chainloader /ntldr  
title Find and Load CMLDR of Windows NT/2K/XP  
find --set-root /cmldr  
chainloader /cmldr  
title find and load IO.SYS of Windows 9x/Me  
find --set-root /io.sys  
chainloader /io.sys  
title find and boot Linux with menu.lst already installed  
find --set-root /sbin/init  
configfile /Boot/grub/menu.lst  
title Floppy (fd0)  
chainloader (fd0)+1  
rootnoverify (fd0)  
title CommandLine  
commandline  
title Reboot  
reboot  
title Halt  
halt  
-----------------------

enforceing people its against freedom. they try to enforce you their idelogy!

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
No ideology whatever enforced (not even an attempt to enforce it).

A simple comment to highlight how the original message arrived strong and clear.

Now, by threatening non-helpers with the fear of bad karma, you might actually limit their freedom, a nice CATCH 22. ![:dubbio:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/dubbio.gif)

You are *demanding* that that correct syntax is given to you (provided that it does exist and that someone knows it and is willing to provide it) and are *insisting on* it, I just underlined this aspect of your post.

And I am now going elsewhere**^\[1\]^** ..., nice to have met you again, be well :smile:.

![:duff:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/duff.gif)

Wonko

**^\[1\]^**only to make this known - just in case - to the Entity assigning bad karma:

it's not that I know the correct syntax *but* I won't provide it, actually I ++don't know++ the specific correct syntax *and thus* I *cannot* provide it.

forumNotes.author: alacran
forumNotes.content: If suggest you ask friendly and not demanding next time. I use this in my menu.lst, to boot from "**Isos**" folder on internal HDD (third partition), or from USB drive : ``` title Acronis Bootable Media 2016\nRun AcronisBootableMedia2016.iso ##ISO file must be contiguous on disk in this case, use Wincontig find --set-root /Isos/AcronisBootableMedia2016.iso map /Isos/AcronisBootableMedia2016.iso (0xFF) map --hook chainloader (0xFF) ```

forumNotes.author: livedude
forumNotes.content:
alacran:

> If suggest you ask friendly and not demanding next time.

i wrote above:

> so all threads wich **inculpate me for demanding** will be ignored.

nothing more to say...

back to the term of this thread:

i think i have found the solution by myself.

i gave it a short try and it works:

----------  
title Acronis True Image Home 2016 ISO  
find --set-root /iso/TrueImageHome2016.iso  
map --heads=0 --sectors-per-track=0 /iso/TrueImageHome2016.iso (hd32)  
map --hook  
root (hd32)  
chainloader  
------------------  
i hope this also helps others!  
if it helps someone i am glad and i enforce no one to nothing to get help.  
real help must always be unconditional!

so the proplem is solved, admin please close this thread.
